column4: I have an issue. I have an OOOOOLD Automatix installation. I installed Swiftweasel with it. I want to remove swiftweasel and install the new version properly. I am running Intrepid. I also need to uninstall Automatix and have no clue how to go about doing it
remember Automatix? from 7.10? I still have it and i want rid of it
yes, we *never* supported automatix
what do you want me to do
anything you like
we've always strongly advised against it
the point was to provide you the background on the reasons why
i was looking forward to finding out something i don't already know. So far, i'm disappointed.
i do know this whole "impossible to remove it" thing has got to be bunk and a cop-out
if it were official ubuntu software in the repositories, you might have reason to complain to us
Show me where I complained
it's unfortunate you chose to install unofficial software, and now want to blame us, as if it was in some way something we did
your previous two comments

so far you've had the supposition that I am both some kind of Automatix adovcate that needs talking out of using it after the damage is done, and that I am here to whine about it. I came here for some sort of recommendation beyond what somebody at Dell tech support in India would say with Windows "Okay, we'll just reinstall your entire operating system that will fix it"
I've had no such supposition, there's just nothing we can recommend for you
nonsense
actually you'd be amazed at what you can accomplish over the phone
it's not reasonable to demand support for random, third-party, unofficial software
show me where i said i'm responsible.
drop it.
spare us, and stay on topic, please
show me where i'm not on topic
drop the attitude
I don't know what you mean. Please stay on topic.
